body.name: ARCTIC Freezer 7 X - Compact Multi-Compatible CPU Fan, 100 mm PWM CPU Air Cooler, Compatible with Intel & AMD Sockets, Intel LGA 1700, 300-2000 RPM (PWM Controlled), Pre-Applied MX-4 Thermal Paste
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 16 hrs 7 mins
features: EXCELLENT COOLING PERFORMANCE: A 100 mm PWM fan, 44 fins, 2 double-sided 6 mm copper heatpipes in combination with pre-applied MX-4 high performance thermal paste provide excellent cooling performance
EFFICIENT AND WHISPER QUIET: At maximum speed the fan of the Freezer 7 X consumes only 0.07 A at a volume of whisper quiet 0.3 Sone
OPTIMAL COMPATIBILITY: The Freezer 7 X can be mounted on most current desktop processors. AMD Socket: AM5, AM4, AM3(+), FM1/2(+); Intel Socket: 1700, 1200, 115x
EASY INSTALLATION: By using the mounting frame a simple installation is possible even without removing the mainboard
INCLUDING PRE-APPLIED THERMAL COMPOUND: Freezer 7 X comes with ARCTIC MX-4 thermal compound already applied, so the CPU cooler can be put into operation immediately
body.description: ARCTIC offers innovative solutions incessantly - changing impossible user requirements into new. Always focused on our customers, ARCTIC is devoted to deliver excellence through a strong dedication and a high sense of commitment. In light of the ever-changing consumer landscapes, we aspire to continue to expand and diversify our products and solutions. From computer cooling and peripherals to audio and digital home entertainment, we strive to enrich people's lives by creating innovative, user friendly yet affordable products with a great value of benefit. For us value for money is a key factor - a constant our customers rely on.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: A worthy Freezer 7 Pro successor The ARCTIC Freezer 7 X is a compact CPU cooler with one 100 mm fan. It is multi-compatible with common Intel and AMD sockets. It benefits from an improved heatsink design and a reworked heat pipe layout. In conjunction with the fan, which is optimised for high static pressure, ARCTIC was been able to significantly improve the Freezer 7 X's cooling performance. P-fan for Increased Performance Inspired by the P-series, the Freezer 7 X fan benefits from all of the advantages of P-fans: * High static pressure for increased cooling performance * Broad RPM range * Lower power consumption * Less vibration * PWM for synchronous fan control Longer lifespan thanks to its low coil temperature The Freezer 7 X uses a fan motor newly developed by ARCTIC. This runs less audibly and more efficiently, so that the temperature of the coils is 20 °C lower than with conventional motors. This increases the lifespan of the fans considerably. Offset heat pipes enable optimal heat dissipation The direct touch heat pipes attached to the Freezer 7 X and an optimised design of the 44 cooling fins together ensure that the heat from the CPU can be ideally removed and released into the air.

Technical Specifications Compatibility Intel Socket: 1700, 1200, 115x AMD Socket: AM5, AM4, AM3(+), FM1/2(+) RAM Clearance: unlimited Heatsink Heat Pipes: 2 Fin Material: Aluminum Number of Fins: 44 Fin Thickness: 0,4 mm Thermal Paste: MX-4 pre-applied Fan Fan Size: 100 mm Fan Speed: 300-2000 rpm Fan Bearing: Fluid Dynamic Bearing Noise Level: 0.3 Sone Current: 0.07 A Connector: 4-Pin Connector Size & Weight Lenght: 74.3 mm Width: 110.5 mm Height: 132.5 mm Weight: 425 g

Freezer 7 X Freezer 7 X CO Freezer i13 X Freezer i13 X CO Freezer A13 X Bearing Fluid Dynamic Bearing Dual Ball Bearing Fluid Dynamic Bearing Dual Ball Bearing Fluid Dynamic Bearing Technology Air Cooling Air Cooling Air Cooling Air Cooling Air Cooling AMD Socket AM5, AM4, AM3(+), FM1/2(+) AM5, AM4, AM3(+), FM1/2(+) / / AM5, AM4 Intel Socket 1700, 1200, 115x 1700, 1200, 115x 1700, 1200, 115x 1700, 1200, 115x / Fan 100 mm 100 mm 100 mm 100 mm 100 mm Fan Speed 300–2000 rpm 300–2000 rpm 300–2000 rpm 300–2000 rpm 300–2000 rpm Dimensions 74.3 x 112 x 132.5 mm 74.3 x 112 x 132.5 mm 85.5 x 112 x 137.5 mm 85.5 x 112 x 137.5 mm 85.5 x 112 x 137.5 mm Weight 425 g 425 g 443 g 443 g 443 g

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Improved temps across the board (10* @ idle | 18* @ load)
reviews.reviewText: This cooler improved my temperatures across the board. 10 degrees cooler at idle and 18 degrees cooler under load using Prime95 benchmark testing. I was testing it against a stock Intel cpu cooler that comes with the processoer.The mounting system is very easy to figure out but slightly difficult to install IF your motherboard is already in the case. I had to pull the mobo out to get it installed properly. You might be able to get it installed easily if you have a big case. My case is medium sized and I did not have enough clearance to reach one of the screws on one side.When under full load the stock cooler was very noticeable in sound. I don't hear anything now when the CPU is under load. The large fan is quiet and has maxed out at 1,400 rpm.Great purchase. Very affordable, well built for the money and it gets the job done. First time using an Arctic product but I'll be looking to them in the future now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is QUIET!
reviews.reviewText: The package came well packed. All parts were there for the install. Total time for swapping the cooler was about 10 min., this includes opening and closing the case. So far, the cooler is working quite well. Very quiet and keeping the temps down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quiet as a mouse
reviews.reviewText: For the last 6 years, ever since I built my first computer. I made the mistake of purchasing an INTEL fan instead of AMD fan for my computer, so it didn't fit and forced me to use the stock fan that came with the AMD 8350-black edition. FOR 6 YEARS, I used that fan and assumed that the JET level noise that came from it was a normal thing.The reason why I didn't get a new CPU fan for such a long time, was because I spent 8 HOURS, trying to get the stupid Intel Fan to fit an AMD motherboard. I felt so stupid when I finally decided to double check the box and figured out the problem, that I just decided to leave it be and just be thankful I had a working computer.AND God help you, if you were playing an intense game like FF15, because that fan would be so loud...but I got use to it over time and learned to ignore it with headphones. But I finally decided nearly a month ago to try and purchase a new fan, since some of my compotents were getting on in the years and I wanted to add some new thermal paste to my CPU to keep it running optimal.Well, lo' and behold, I put this 7x Artic Freezer fan in my CPU and I freaked out for a second, thinking I didn't install it right, because I couldn't hear anything from it. But after 10 minutes of leaving my computer on and checking the fan, nothing was wrong... the fan was working, it was just quiet as HELL compared to the stock fan I'd been using for so many years.So yeah...this fan is amazing, and I'm upset with myself for not purchasing this sooner. I really am an idiot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good fan for a good price.
reviews.reviewText: Definitely works well. I have a hot CPU and this brought temps down a good deal. It's getting 4 stars because it arrived bent and wouldn't mount properly because of that. Thankfully it wasn't bent too crazy, so I fixed it myself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can be tricky to install
reviews.reviewText: Had a little bit of an issue and selling this couldn't get the second clip to engage right ended up pulling out all of the PCI cards out of the computer which let me manipulate the connectors which looking back probably should have done that in the start with so far had it a week and temperatures are running about 10 degrees cooler for me than my stuck cooler but it was also a nine-year-old cooler too. It is nice it does let you install it multiple directions you can have it pushing air out the back of the case pulling air in from the back of the case pushing air up through the top of the case or pulling air down from the top of the case so it gives you some mounting options

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replacement Intel stock fan
reviews.reviewText: I have an i5 13400F. In term of noise, the Intel stock fan is slightly less noisy. In term of CPU temperature, running 2 minutes of Cinebench, the temperature is about 20 degrees less than with Intel stock fan, 65C instead of 85C. In the Idle mode, it's 5C cooler than using Intel stock fan (35C instead of 40C). Installation is about 3 minutes. I am happy and keep Artic freezer 7 X.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It works, but tricky mount
reviews.reviewText: The good: the cooler does work and operates quietly.The bad: first, the cooler doesn't fully cover an AM3+ CPU. More importantly however is how difficult this ended up being to mount. The brackets rotate freely as you try to hook them into place over the AMD cooler brackets (maybe Intel folks will have a better time). Once you do finally get them to line up and snap on, you're now left to manually screw the brackets down to bring the cooler to a firm contact with the CPU. Other manufacturers typically use a lever mechanism for this instead. If your case doesn't have much clearance up top, you'll soon find you cannot reach any type of screwdriver whatsoever - even the thin ones - into the case to be able to tighten the top screw down. This, coupled with the fact that the cooler fins aren't even mounted evenly above the retention mechanism made it so that the screw needed to be screwed in at an angle. I had to take the cooler back out, re-apply new thermal paste since the now-used thermal pad would have been inadequate to re-mount, fully tightly the top bracket since it couldn't be screwed on when installed, and push-and-pray as I hooked these tightened retention brackets onto the board. Should have been a 10 minute install, took an hour. The cooler is on now and operates fine, but if I ever need to remove it again, its going right into the garbage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great upgrade to stock intel cooler (i5 9400f)
reviews.reviewText: This review is for Arctic 7x variant. Chose this for a cheap upgrade to the intel stock cooler for the i5 9400f. While the stock cooler was adequate at cooling the CPU it was annoyingly loud. My PC sits on the floor and I could still hear it from up on my desk. This budget option seemed to fit the bill when I was searching for a replacement. It was fairly simple to install and is very sturdy. After installing, the first thing I noticed is how quiet it is. Bonus is it keeps my CPU much cooler than stock cooler! My temps during gaming went from ~65C down to ~50C.

I was in a pinch and needed a cooler quick, I was upgrading my am3 platform to an am4 with a ryzen 5 5600g. My old coolermaster 212 would not mount, so took to pcpartsbuilder Canada to find an affordable remedy. The Arctic 7 x got really good reviews, and the price was right. Knowing my case has always produced good thermals, and the 5600g isn't a super high voltage cpu, it was worth trying. It comes all ready to mount to an am4 board, with pre-applied thermal paste, so installation was really quick and easy. It keeps my cpu under 60c while gaming, and never gets loud enough to stand out from my case fans. Now I wouldn't be pairing this up to a top end cpu, but why would someone who can afford one of those, skimp out on its' cooler?For the money, this little cooler is tough to beat, easy to install, better than oem coolers, and looks pretty good while doing it. I'd definitely recommend!

Product was received quickly. Was a little more difficult to install but I think that may have more to do with how little room I have around the CPU fan as opposed to the design of the fan. So far it's been working great so no complaints there.

I had an issue with the fan rattling upon installation. After contacting Arctic, they sent a replacement part free of charge without any hassle. Just replaced the fan on the cooler with the new one they sent, and it's running perfectly now. The same quiet performance I expect from Arctic, and why I've kept coming back to their products for so many years.
Highly recommend this cpu cooler It’s good performance,a little tricky to install but it’s silent and good 👍

Sooooo much better than the crappy Intel stock cooler. Dropped at least 10C while benchmarking and so much quiet, I can barely hear it. My I5 9400 cannot make it run at full speed, even in my bad airflow case.
